security_audit.summary: Official skill from Anthropic with documentation content and examples. No security review required beyond basic metadata checks.

content.value_statement: You need clear guidance to build reliable slash commands for Claude Code. This skill gives structures, frontmatter options, and tested patterns.
actual_capabilities: Explains slash command file locations and Markdown format
Details YAML frontmatter fields and usage rules
Shows dynamic arguments with $ARGUMENTS and positional variables
Explains file reference syntax with @ paths
Describes bash execution patterns and allowed-tools usage
Provides plugin-specific patterns and validation examples
limitations: Does not execute commands or modify repositories
Does not validate your command files automatically
Focuses on Claude Code command format, not other platforms

use_cases.title: Standardize team commands
use_cases.description: Create consistent project commands with documented arguments and safe tool scopes.

use_cases.title: Build plugin workflows
use_cases.description: Design commands that integrate plugin scripts, agents, and templates.

use_cases.title: Speed up daily tasks
use_cases.description: Add personal commands for reviews, tests, and documentation work.

prompt_templates.title: Create a basic command
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a simple review command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Claude Code slash command named /review that reviews code for quality issues. Include a short description and no extra tools.

prompt_templates.title: Add arguments
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a command /review-pr that takes a PR number and priority. Use argument-hint and positional arguments in the prompt.

prompt_templates.title: Use file references
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to review a specific file
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a command /review-file that accepts a file path and uses @ to include the file contents.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin workflow command
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a multi-step plugin command
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a plugin command that runs a script from ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}, validates inputs, and then uses a template file.

output_examples.input: Create a command that deploys to staging with a version argument
output: Prompt text using $1 and $2 for environment and version
Note about allowed-tools if bash is required

best_practices: Use clear descriptions and argument-hint for discoverability
Limit allowed-tools to the minimum required scope
Validate missing or invalid arguments in the prompt
anti_patterns: Writing commands as messages to users instead of instructions to Claude
Using Bash(*) when a narrower scope is sufficient
Skipping error handling for missing files or arguments

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code slash commands?
faq.answer: Yes, it targets the Claude Code command format and locations.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not execute or validate commands.

faq.question: Can it integrate with plugin scripts and templates?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes patterns using ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} paths.

faq.question: Does it collect or transmit data?
faq.answer: No, it is static guidance with no data access.

faq.question: What if my command does not appear in /help?
faq.answer: Check file location, extension, and frontmatter syntax.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic prompt advice?
faq.answer: It is specific to Claude Code command structure and tooling.
